definitions.definition: ( countable or uncountable ) An act of bluffing; a false expression of the strength of one’s position in order to intimidate or deceive ; braggadocio .
examples: That is only bluff , or That is only a bluff .

definitions.definition: ( poker , countable or uncountable ) An attempt to represent oneself as holding a stronger hand than one actually does.
examples: John’s bet was a bluff : he bet without even so much as a pair.

definitions.definition: ( US , dated , uncountable ) The card game poker .
( countable ) One who bluffs; a bluffer .
( slang , dated , countable or uncountable ) Pretense , excuse .

main_definition: ( countable or uncountable ) An act of bluffing; a false expression of the strength of one’s position in order to intimidate or deceive ; braggadocio .
secondary_definitions: ( poker , countable or uncountable ) An attempt to represent oneself as holding a stronger hand than one actually does.
( US , dated , uncountable ) The card game poker .
( countable ) One who bluffs; a bluffer .
( slang , dated , countable or uncountable ) Pretense , excuse .

definitions.definition: A high, steep bank , for example by a river or the sea, or beside a ravine or plain; a cliff with a broad face.
A small wood or stand of trees, typically poplar or willow .

main_definition: A high, steep bank , for example by a river or the sea, or beside a ravine or plain; a cliff with a broad face.
secondary_definitions: ( Canadian Prairies ) A small wood or stand of trees, typically poplar or willow .
